content: give me those customers who have next payment due okay give me there email , name and next payment due

**🧠 Thought:** _**  
The user wants customers who have a next payment due.  
We need to filter rows where `PaymentDueDate` is not missing and then return the customer’s email, name (first and last), and the next payment due date.

**_

Found 10000 records with 4 columns (CustomersEMail, CustomersFirstName, CustomersLastName, PaymentDueDate):

• CustomersEMail: robert.white1@mail.com | CustomersFirstName: Robert | CustomersLastName: White | PaymentDueDate: 12/29/2021
• CustomersEMail: william.sanchez2@emailtest.org | CustomersFirstName: William | CustomersLastName: Sanchez | PaymentDueDate: 01/20/2022
• CustomersEMail: michael.robinson3@mail.com | CustomersFirstName: Michael | CustomersLastName: Robinson | PaymentDueDate: 02/27/2024

Showing all in the table below.
now give me only those customers of 2025 who have payment due date and also give me there payment due amount

**🧠 Thought:** _**  
We need customers whose payment due date falls in 2025 and who actually have a payment due date (i.e., the date is not missing). The user also wants the amount due. In the schema the relevant columns are:

- `PaymentDueDate` – the due date  
- `NextPaymentDueAmount` – the amount due  
- `CustomersLastName` and `CustomersFirstName` – to identify the customer

We’ll convert the date column to datetime, filter for year 2025, drop any rows with missing values, and return only the requested columns.

**_

Found 1777 records with 4 columns (CustomersLastName, CustomersFirstName, PaymentDueDate, NextPaymentDueAmount):

• CustomersLastName: White | CustomersFirstName: Nancy | PaymentDueDate: 2025-02-24 00:00:00 | NextPaymentDueAmount: 300
• CustomersLastName: Lewis | CustomersFirstName: John | PaymentDueDate: 2025-05-28 00:00:00 | NextPaymentDueAmount: 250
• CustomersLastName: Jackson | CustomersFirstName: Betty | PaymentDueDate: 2025-08-23 00:00:00 | NextPaymentDueAmount: 500

Showing all in the table below.
now calculate there payment due amount

**🧠 Thought:** _**  
The user wants the total payment due amount. The relevant numeric column in the dataset is `NextPaymentDueAmount`. We will calculate the sum of this column.

**_

📊 **Analysis Complete!**

**Your Question:** now calculate there payment due amount

**Result:** 2824150

📈 *Based on 10,000 total records in the dataset*
